definitions.definition: in general and without considering minor details.
definitions.example: the climate is broadly similar in the two regions

definitions.definition: widely and openly.
definitions.example: he was grinning broadly

definitions.definition: having been broken.
definitions.example: he had a broken arm

definitions.definition: (of a person) having given up all hope; despairing.
definitions.example: he went to his grave a broken man

definitions.definition: having breaks or gaps in continuity.
definitions.example: a broken white line across the road

definitions.definition: having an uneven and rough surface.
definitions.example: he pressed onwards over the broken ground

definitions.definition: separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.
definitions.example: the rope broke with a loud snap

definitions.definition: interrupt (a continuity, sequence, or course).
definitions.example: the new government broke the pattern of growth

definitions.definition: fail to observe (a law, regulation, or agreement).
definitions.example: the council says it will prosecute traders who break the law

definitions.definition: crush the emotional strength, spirit, or resistance of.
definitions.example: the idea was to better the prisoners, not to break them

definitions.definition: undergo a change or enter a new state, in particular:
definitions.example: the weather broke and thunder rumbled through a leaden sky

definitions.definition: (of news or a scandal) suddenly become public.
definitions.example: since the news broke I've received thousands of wonderful letters

definitions.definition: (chiefly of an attacking player or team, or of a military force) make a rush or dash in a particular direction.
definitions.example: Mitchell won possession and broke quickly, allowing Hughes to score

definitions.definition: a man or boy in relation to other sons and daughters of his parents.
definitions.example: he recognized her from her strong resemblance to her brother

definitions.definition: used to express annoyance or surprise.
definitions.example: oh brother!

definitions.definition: brown colour or pigment.
definitions.example: the brown of his eyes

definitions.definition: of a colour produced by mixing red, yellow, and blue, as of dark wood or rich soil.
definitions.example: an old brown coat

definitions.definition: a light and fleeting touch.
definitions.example: the lightest brush of his lips against her cheek

definitions.definition: the bushy tail of a fox.
definitions.example: a fox's brush

definitions.definition: an implement with a handle and a block of bristles, hair, or wire, used especially for cleaning, applying a liquid or powder to a surface, or arranging the hair.
definitions.example: a shaving brush

definitions.definition: a drumstick with long wire bristles, used to make a soft hissing sound on drums or cymbals.
a marine mollusc that typically has a thin scroll-like shell.
used to refer to a good or fortunate situation that is isolated from reality or unlikely to last.
definitions.example: we both lived in a bubble, the kind provided by occupying a privileged pied-Ã -terre in Greenwich Village

definitions.definition: a transparent domed cover or enclosure.
definitions.example: piglets born into a sterile bubble

definitions.definition: (of a liquid) form rising bubbles of gas or air.
definitions.example: a pot of coffee bubbled away on the stove

definitions.definition: a thin sphere of liquid enclosing air or another gas.
definitions.example: we'd shake up a piece of soap in a tin of warm water and blow bubbles

definitions.definition: an estimate of income and expenditure for a set period of time.
definitions.example: keep within the household budget

definitions.definition: construct (something) by putting parts or material together.
definitions.example: the ironworks were built in 1736

definitions.definition: make or become stronger or more intense.
definitions.example: we built up confidence in our abilities

definitions.definition: the proportions of a person's or animal's body.
definitions.example: she was of medium height and slim build

definitions.definition: the style or form of construction of something, especially a vehicle.
definitions.example: the car's high specification and impressive build quality

definitions.definition: construct (something) by putting parts or material together.
definitions.example: the ironworks were built in 1736

definitions.definition: make or become stronger or more intense.
definitions.example: we built up confidence in our abilities

definitions.definition: a structure with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory.
definitions.example: the church is a plain red brick building

definitions.definition: the action or trade of constructing something.
definitions.example: the building of motorways

definitions.definition: a metal projectile for firing from a rifle, revolver, or other small firearm, typically cylindrical and pointed, and sometimes containing an explosive.
definitions.example: the ball sped across the grass like a bullet

definitions.definition: a number of things, typically of the same kind, growing or fastened together.
definitions.example: a bunch of grapes

definitions.definition: collect or fasten into a compact group.
definitions.example: she bunched the needles together

definitions.definition: produce (a CD or DVD) by copying from an original or master copy.
a small stream.
(of a fire) flame or glow while consuming a material such as coal or wood.
definitions.example: a fire burned and crackled cheerfully in the grate

definitions.definition: be or cause to be destroyed by fire.
definitions.example: he watched his restaurant burn to the ground

definitions.definition: be entirely possessed by (a desire or an emotion).
definitions.example: Martha was burning with curiosity

definitions.definition: an injury caused by exposure to heat or flame.
definitions.example: he was treated in hospital for burns to his hands

definitions.definition: consumption of a type of fuel as an energy source.
definitions.example: natural gas produces the cleanest burn of the lot

definitions.definition: past and past participle of burn1.
separate (continuous stationery) into single sheets.
break open or apart suddenly and violently, especially as a result of an impact or internal pressure.
definitions.example: one of the balloons burst

definitions.definition: issue suddenly and uncontrollably.
definitions.example: the words burst from him in an angry rush

definitions.definition: suddenly begin doing or producing something.
definitions.example: Sophie burst out laughing

definitions.definition: an instance of breaking or splitting as a result of internal pressure or puncturing; an explosion.
definitions.example: the mortar bursts were further away than before

definitions.definition: a sudden brief outbreak.
definitions.example: a burst of activity

definitions.definition: a period of continuous and intense effort.
definitions.example: he sailed 474 miles in one 24-hour burst

definitions.definition: put or hide underground.
definitions.example: he buried the box in the back garden

definitions.definition: cover (someone or something) completely.
definitions.example: the countryside has been buried under layers of concrete

definitions.definition: a shrub or clump of shrubs with stems of moderate length.
definitions.example: a rose bush

definitions.definition: (especially in Australia and Africa) wild or uncultivated country.
definitions.example: they have to spend a night camping in the bush

definitions.definition: a luxuriant growth of thick hair or fur.
definitions.example: a childish face with a bush of bright hair

definitions.definition: Theatre
a person's regular occupation, profession, or trade.
definitions.example: experts who typically conduct their business over the Internet

definitions.definition: commercial activity.
definitions.example: firms who want to do business with Japan

definitions.definition: having a great deal to do.
definitions.example: he had been too busy to enjoy himself

definitions.definition: excessively detailed or decorated.
definitions.example: the lavish set designs are a little too busy

definitions.definition: keep oneself occupied.
definitions.example: she busied herself with her new home

definitions.definition: a police officer.
definitions.example: I was picked up by the busies for possession

definitions.definition: used to indicate the impossibility of anything other than what is being stated.
definitions.example: one cannot but sympathize

definitions.definition: used to introduce a response expressing a feeling such as surprise or anger.
definitions.example: but that's an incredible saving!

definitions.definition: used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned.
definitions.example: he stumbled but didn't fall

definitions.definition: a pale yellow edible fatty substance made by churning cream and used as a spread or in cooking.
